intro: Hyphear kaoi, commonly known as the Hawaiian skyrocket, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Santalaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Hyphear kaoi plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and food for native insects and birds.
